definition: to mix/to mingle/to interfere/to meddle
to take by the arm and assist/to mix/to blend/to dilute/to adulterate
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"

sentences.english: I don't want to get involved in the business you told me last night.
sentences.chinese: 我不想搀和到你昨晚告诉我的这个生意中去。

definition: to mix together/mixture/blend
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
variant of 趟渾水|趟浑水[tang1 hun2 shui3]
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
(fig.) to get involved in an unsavory enterprise
to implicate
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
not to get involved/to stay out of it
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to have no right or ability to interfere in sth/it's none of your business!
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
meddling in other people's business
other people's business
not worthwhile
